intro: Heracleum cyclocarpum, commonly known as the clustered cow parsnip, is a tall biennial or short-lived perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive white underside, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. Its fruits are spherical and contain a single seed, which is a characteristic feature of the species. The plant is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
